name: chart_1771368183004_chart
observations: Chart created on 2026-02-17T22:43:03.004Z

elementsOfPerformance.description: Relations modeled as first-class entities with lifecycle — Wilson's ontology honored in schema
Tool teaches Indigenous ways of knowing through the act of building and using it
Communities see their own relational patterns in forms they recognize
OCAP governance structural at data layer — sovereignty not decorative
Research questions remain alive as structural tension — not prematurely collapsed

name: chart_1771368183004_desired_outcome
observations: A modular, open ontology platform (@medicine-wheel/*) where Indigenous relational knowing and Western graph technology meet without one subsuming the other — where the tool itself teaches Indigenous ways of knowing through the act of building and using it (creative practice research), where communities see their own relational patterns rendered in forms they recognize, and where the research questions remain alive as sustained structural tension rather than collapsing into premature closure.

name: chart_1771368183004_current_reality
observations: Medicine Wheel MCP prototype exists (23+ tools, Redis, Four Directions). UI exists (Next.js — graph viz, medicine wheel view, narrative beats, nodes/relations/ceremonies/accountability pages). CONTENT.md research payload analyzed (42+ sources: Kaupapa Maori, Wilson, RDF, 3 viz libraries as abstract classes, 5-layer architecture, 8 research questions, 5 future directions). v0.dev session identified 5 extractable packages. Grok session with Ava defined relational embodiment and presence protocol. No RDF vocabulary. No graph-native storage. No ceremony-as-write-operation. Flat JSON in Redis. No ontology browser. No cycle pattern recognition. No accountability relationship mapping beyond basic UI.

CONTENT.md Section 6 identifies 3 RDF visualization libraries as abstract classes to evaluate, extend, and integrate: (1) RDFGlance — Rust/WASM high-performance RDF inspector, client-side processing aligns with OCAP sovereignty, pattern: RdfInspectorEngine → IndigenousRelationalInspector; (2) rdf-viz — TypeScript/D3 semantic graph with RDF-aware predicate rendering, JSON config system extensible for ceremony templates, pattern: SemanticGraphView → MedicineWheelGraphView; (3) react-d3-graph — React component for interactive D3 graphs with custom node views (viewGenerator), pattern: InteractiveGraphWidget → MedicineWheelRelationalWidget. These 3 libraries need hands-on evaluation, prototyping, and comparative benchmarking before integration decisions.

CONTENT.md Section 7 proposes 5 evolution pathways: (1) Ontology refactor — core RDF vocabulary + migration from Redis JSON, (2) Relational accountability model — Wilson's 3 Rs + OCAP as RDF resources on every beat/ceremony/relation, (3) Visualization layering — react-d3-graph widget + RDFGlance inspector + rdf-viz semantic overlay, (4) Ceremonial workflows around MMOT — ceremonies that snapshot current reality against visions, (5) OCAP-aware data flows — OCAP/IDS labeling + client-side WASM processing for sovereignty.

CONTENT.md Section 8 poses 8 research questions (4 ontological/epistemological + 4 interaction/UX) that must remain alive as structural tension throughout the work, not be prematurely collapsed into technical decisions.

Strategy crystallized: Apply RISE framework (Reverse-engineer, Intent, Specifications, Export) to the 2 forked repos (mwds-react-d3-graph, mwds-rdfglance) to produce rispecs. These rispecs then feed v0.dev (session: v0.app/chat/indigenous-wheeling-packages-260217-hPU7CAww97C) for implementation of the 5 @medicine-wheel/* packages. V0.md in artefacts folder holds v0.dev's independent analysis of expected article structure, 7 pre-writing artifacts, and 5 package definitions — a second knowledge path that should converge with CONTENT.md analysis.
Pipeline: fork repos → RISE reverse-engineer → extract intent → write rispecs → export to v0.dev → v0 generates package implementations → integrate into mcp-medicine-wheel and mcp-medicine-wheel-ui

[2026-02-21] Major state shift: v0.dev has generated all 5 @medicine-wheel/* packages as real TypeScript code in /workspace/repos/jgwill/medicine-wheel/src/. ontology-core: 100% complete (types, Zod schemas, RDF vocabulary with 6 namespaces, 23 semantic query helpers, constants with Ojibwe names). graph-viz: 90% (pure SVG React component, circular medicine wheel layout, OCAP badges, Wilson halos). narrative-engine: 95% (beat sequencer, cadence patterns, arc validator, cycle manager, timeline builder). relational-query: 85% (fluent query builder, BFS traversal, OCAP-only mode, accountability audit). ui-components: 70% (DirectionCard, BeatTimeline, NodeInspector, OcapBadge, WilsonMeter). All packages have dist/ builds.

name: chart_1771368377825_chart
observations: Chart created on 2026-02-17T22:46:17.825Z

name: chart_1771368377825_desired_outcome
observations: @medicine-wheel/ontology-core — RDF + relational data model, direction/act/ceremony type system, temporal beats tracking, relations as first-class entities with lifecycle

name: chart_1771368377825_current_reality
observations: RelationalMemoryStore exists in relational-memory.ts. RelationalNode: {id, type (6 union types), name, description, direction, metadata, timestamps}. RelationalEdge: {from_id, to_id, relationship_type, strength 0-1, ceremony_honored, obligations[]}. CeremonyLog: {type (5 ceremony types), direction, participants, medicines, intentions}. Storage is Redis hashes — no URIs, no triples, no named graphs, no RDF vocabulary. Relations stored as simple key-value pairs keyed by from:to — not entities with their own lifecycle. getRelationalWeb() does BFS traversal returning flat arrays. No temporal/cyclical metadata on edges. No OCAP flags on nodes or edges. Types hardcoded in TypeScript unions, no schema registry.

[2026-02-21] v0 generated ontology-core package — COMPLETE. Full type system: DirectionName, RelationalNode, RelationalEdge, Relation, OcapFlags, AccountabilityTracking, CeremonyLog, NarrativeBeat, MedicineWheelCycle, StructuralTensionChart. Zod validation schemas paired with every type. RDF vocabulary with 6 namespace IRIs (MW, OCAP, IDS, REL, CER, BEAT). 23 semantic query helpers (Wilson alignment metrics, OCAP compliance auditing, relational traversal). Constants with Ojibwe names, seasons, medicines, teachings. Export subpaths: ./types, ./schemas, ./vocabulary, ./constants, ./queries. Relations are now first-class entities with their own type system. This is the spine.

name: chart_1771368410616_chart
observations: Chart created on 2026-02-17T22:46:50.616Z

name: chart_1771368410616_desired_outcome
observations: @medicine-wheel/graph-viz — Force-directed layout with cultural overlays, Medicine Wheel geometric constraints, node type theming, dual rendering (Western graph / Indigenous relational)

name: chart_1771368410616_current_reality
observations: UI has 9 page routes: medicine wheel, nodes, relations, ceremonies, narrative, beats, cycles, accountability, plus layout. Nodes page renders a table/list of relational nodes from API. Relations page shows edges as list items. No graph visualization component — no force-directed layout, no D3 integration, no react-d3-graph. No radial Medicine Wheel rendering — the wheel page exists but uses static directional cards, not a geometric layout. No node type theming beyond text labels. No dual rendering mode. No cultural overlay system. v0.dev session identified react-d3-graph, rdf-viz, and RDFGlance as abstract classes but none are integrated.

3 RDF visualization libraries identified for evaluation: RDFGlance (Rust/WASM, high-performance, client-side — github.com/xdobry/rdfglance), rdf-viz (TypeScript/D3, RDF-predicate-aware, JSON config — github.com/clecompt-msft/rdf-viz), react-d3-graph (React/D3, custom viewGenerator, active ecosystem — github.com/danielcaldas/react-d3-graph). None evaluated hands-on yet. None integrated. Each has a defined abstract class pattern and Indigenous extension strategy in CONTENT.md Section 6.

2 of 3 libraries forked: mwds-react-d3-graph at /workspace/repos/jgwill/mwds-react-d3-graph, mwds-rdfglance at /workspace/repos/jgwill/mwds-rdfglance. rdf-viz dropped — 7 years without commits, dead upstream. Two active abstract classes remain for evaluation and Indigenous extension.

Next action when work begins: RISE both forks — reverse-engineer mwds-react-d3-graph and mwds-rdfglance, extract intent relative to @medicine-wheel/graph-viz desired outcome, write rispecs for each extension pattern (MedicineWheelRelationalWidget, IndigenousRelationalInspector), export specs to v0.dev for implementation.

[2026-02-21] v0 generated graph-viz package — 90% complete. MedicineWheelGraph React component: pure SVG (no D3 runtime), circular layout engine with quadrant geometry, curved Bezier links, direction-aware coloring, OCAP compliance badges on nodes, Wilson alignment halos. Data converters: nodes→graph, edges→graph, relations→graph (detects first-class relations). 11 toggle flags on props. Hover/selection state. No force-directed mode yet — only radial wheel layout. Forked repos (mwds-react-d3-graph, mwds-rdfglance) not yet integrated but RISE analysis planned.

name: chart_1771368430040_chart
observations: Chart created on 2026-02-17T22:47:10.040Z

name: chart_1771368430040_desired_outcome
observations: @medicine-wheel/narrative-engine — Beat sequencing across Four Directions, timeline/categorical view components, ceremonial cadence patterns, cross-episode arc continuity

name: chart_1771368430040_current_reality
observations: Narrative beats page exists at /narrative/beats — renders beats as cards with title, description, direction, act number, timestamp. Cycles page exists at /narrative/cycles. MCP has coaia-narrative integration (NCP bridge) mapping Four Directions to narrative acts (East=Act1, South=Act2, etc). CeremonyLog tracks timeline via Redis sorted set (zAdd/zRange). No beat-state modeling (setup/escalation/climax/resolution). No cross-episode arc continuity validation. No motif recurrence detection. No ceremonial cadence patterns beyond direction assignment. Timeline view exists but is chronological list, not interactive temporal visualization. No cyclical time representation.

[2026-02-21] v0 generated narrative-engine package — 95% complete. Beat sequencer with sort by act/direction and insert validation. Two cadence patterns (STANDARD_CADENCE: ceremony at all 4 phases, LIGHT_CADENCE: opening/closing only). Arc validator: direction coverage, balance score, Wilson alignment, OCAP compliance, violation reporting with recommendations. Cycle manager: direction transitions, full progress computation, next-action suggestions. Timeline builder: chronological, directional, or ceremonial grouping. Act strip helper for viz.

name: chart_1771368442226_chart
observations: Chart created on 2026-02-17T22:47:22.226Z

name: chart_1771368442226_desired_outcome
observations: @medicine-wheel/relational-query — Query builder respecting Indigenous protocols, context-aware relationship traversal, accountability tracking, Wilson alignment metrics

name: chart_1771368442226_current_reality
observations: RelationalMemoryStore has getRelationalWeb(centerNodeId, depth) doing BFS traversal up to depth 2 returning {nodes[], edges[]}. searchNodes(query) does case-insensitive string matching on name/description with relevance sorting. getRelatedNodes(nodeId, direction) returns connected IDs. getNodesByType() and getNodesByDirection() return filtered lists. No path-based relationship tracing beyond BFS. No lineage reconstruction. No accountability mapping (who is connected to what under which protocol). No Wilson alignment metrics computed at query time. No query builder — all queries are programmatic method calls. No contextual result expansion (returns flat nodes, not relational rationale). trackAccountability() stores wilson_score, ocap_compliant, elders_consulted but is a static snapshot, not computed from graph structure.

[2026-02-21] v0 generated relational-query package — 85% complete. Fluent query builder with NodeFilter/EdgeFilter/RelationFilter. Sort (name, created_at, type, direction), pagination. BFS graph traversal with configurable depth, direction (in/out/both), ceremony boundary awareness, OCAP-only traversal mode. Shortest path finder. Neighborhood computation. Accountability audit: OCAP compliance count, Wilson alignment aggregation, direction coverage, ceremony honoring stats, obligations outstanding, relation health detection.

name: chart_1771368455104_chart
observations: Chart created on 2026-02-17T22:47:35.104Z

name: chart_1771368455104_desired_outcome
observations: @medicine-wheel/ui-components — Direction cards, beat timelines, node inspectors, cultural iconography system, dark theme with semantic colors

name: chart_1771368455104_current_reality
observations: UI uses Next.js App Router with 9 page routes. Layout has sidebar navigation linking to: Medicine Wheel, Nodes, Relations, Ceremonies, Narrative, Beats, Cycles, Accountability. Pages fetch from /api/* routes that call MCP tools. Components are page-level — no reusable component library extracted. No direction cards as standalone components. No beat timeline widget. No node inspector panel. No cultural iconography system — directions use emoji icons (sunrise, sun, sunset, snowflake). Dark theme exists via Tailwind but no semantic color system mapped to directions/types. No package boundary — everything lives in the monolithic Next.js app. rispecs define 8 spec files (app, narrative-arc, layout-navigation, accountability, relational-graph, ceremonies, data-layer, medicine-wheel) but components not modularized for extraction.

[2026-02-21] v0 generated ui-components package — 70% complete. 5 building-block components: DirectionCard (Ojibwe names, medicines, season, life stage, clickable), BeatTimeline (horizontal chronological, act labels, ceremony indicators, selection), NodeInspector (type badge, direction, metadata, connected edges with strength/ceremony status), OcapBadge (compact or detailed 4-flag O/C/A/P), WilsonMeter (circular progress gauge 0-1 with color thresholds). All interactive. Intentionally minimal — composable building blocks, not feature-complete screens.
